ygData.subject: Re: Evocation skill
ygData.msgSnippet: From: McConnell, Jeff  ... proceeded back to unrest ... able to cast it. *sigh* So I ... into and headed back out to try
ygData.messageBody:
From: "McConnell, Jeff"
<Jeff.McConnell@...>

> Hello All
> I just purchased the ward undead spell and
proceeded back to unrest
> to test it out and to my dismay I wasn't barely
able to cast it. *sigh* So I
> went to the guilmaster and trained 10 points
into and headed back out to try
> it again and I was only casting once every 10
times or so. Is there another
> spell we have to work this or do we just have to
keep working it this way ?

You must practice it a lot.

I got it at level 15, but since I didn't have the
time to spent practicing it on lower
level undead I waited(I did not want to risk my
life or the life of my friends with
15 fizzles).

At level 19 I had a few hours of free times, so I
went to West Karana, near the North Karana
zone on the river border there is a undead spawn
spot and I practice my skill for nearly 2 hours,
it went up from 30 to 100.

A trick you may want to use for practice, once you
killed a undead, you can still cast
Ward Undead on his corpse until it disapears. I
did that, picked the undead that was
alone, killed it and practice on his corpse, when
it disapeared I killed another and so on.

Hope it helps you.

Zelgadus Brightblade
21st level Paladin of Mithaniel Marr
E'ci
